get.summary: Get the Software known by this LCP to be installed together with this LCP
get.description:
Gets the information of the software that this LCP Knows. This data about software could be used
by an external process to query the CVE database in search for known vulnerabilities after being
retrieved.

If no software is known by the LCP it would retrieve an empty array.

200.description: Get the Description of the Software controlled by the LCP

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post the Description and configuration parameters of Security Agents deployed with LCP
post.description:
Posts the information of the Server software that LCP Knows. This data about software could be used
by an external process to query the CVE database in search for known vulnerabilities after being
retrieved from the LCP.

201.description: The Security Function definition has been successfully updated there.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

delete.summary: Get the Software known by this LCP to be installed together with this LCP
delete.description:

get.summary: Get Description of a container running with the LCP
get.description:
Gets the information of a container (Docker, LXC, etc) running with the LCP and the information of
the software that the container is running. This information could help to depict the deployment in
the node and the Software information could be useful to query the CVE dtabase in search for known
vulnerabilities.

If no container is known by the LCP it would retrieve an empty array.

200.description: Get the Description of the containers and their software running with the LCP

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post the description of a container and the software installed inside it.
post.description:
Posts the information of a container (Docker, LXC, etc) running with the LCP and the information of
the software that the container is running. This information could help to depict the deployment in
the node and the Software information could be useful to query the CVE dtabase in search for known
vulnerabilities.

201.description: The Security Function definition has been successfully updated there.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

delete.summary: Removes an LCP Son given its ID
delete.description: Removes one Son of the queried LCP given its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of LCP son to be queried

200.description: Status data of the LCP.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get a LCP Son given its ID
get.description: Gets one Son of the queried LCP given its ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of LCP son to be queried

200.description: Status data of the LCP.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get the LCP Sons (next LCPs in Service Chain) of this LCP
get.description:
Gets a list of next links in the service chain (LCP sons) to a given execution environment.
Following the LCP Sons the service chain can be quite accurately be depicted.

200.description: List of LCP Sons of the queried LCP.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Add a new LCP Son to a given LCP, so a service chain can be depicted.
post.description:
Post a new LCP Son to a given LCP. Once the LCP knows a new children it could post an
/lcp_parent operation to the children LCP so the children LCP can know which is its
parent LCP and get data to connect the Context Broker.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

delete.summary: Removes the LCP Parent of this LCP.
delete.description: Removes the LCP Parent of this LCP

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get the LCP parent of a LCP
get.description: Gets a list of previous links in the service chain (LCP parents) to a given execution environment.

200.description: List of LCP Sons of the queried LCP.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Add the LCP parent to a given LCP. Once the LCP Son knows its parent, it can connect it so it can get the Context Broker connection data.
post.description:
A LCP presents itself as the parent to another LCP. Once the LCP knows its parent, it can
register itself using /lcp_son POST to the parent LCP, and getting back the Context Broker
connection data.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get the Description of the Cloud Infrastructure
get.description:
Gets the information of the cloud Infrastructure where the LCP is installed on. This description of
the cloud infrastructure could define as inner objects also things like:
* Controllers - Used to control the cloud infrastrucutre
* Compute Nodes - Used to control the Virtual Servers

Although this information will only be informative, not specially relevant.

200.description: Get the description of the Cloud Infrastructure known by the system

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post the Description of the Cloud Infrastructure where the LCP is installed on.
post.description: Posts the information of the cloud Infrastrucutre where the LCP is installed on.

201.description: The Cloud Infrastructure has been successfully updated

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

put.summary: Puts the description of an instance of an Agent instance previously defined.
put.description: Updates the description of an instance known and previously defined.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of Agent Instance to be updated

201.description: The Agent Instance has been successfully updated there.

404.description: Agent instance not previously defined. Use POST method instead.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

delete.description: Deletes an agent type so it can not be used anymore to deploy Agent Instances. If there are known agent instances of this type, it will fail to delete the type. Instances should be deleted first.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of Agent type to be modified

204.description: The Agent Type has been successfully deleted.

404.description: The Agent Type was not found. No deletions performed.

412.description: Precondition failed. There are instances of one type yet, they must be deleted first

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get data relative to the Security Agents defined to be used this LCP
get.description: Gets the information of the Agent Types known by this LCP and the data got.

200.description: Data relative to the Agents known by this LCP agent

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

put.description: Updates the information about an Agent Type that so that an agent can register later to belong this kind

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: id of Agent type to be modified

201.description: The Agent Type has been successfully updated there.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Get the execution environment deployment for the LCP
get.description: Gets the information of the Server where the LCP is deployed.

200.description:
Gets the description of the execution environment. The value for the
environment return value could be one of BaremetalServer, LXC Container,
Docker container, VirtualServer depending on the value for the "type"
of the execution environment.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post the description of the Deployment for the execution environment overriding that calculated
post.description:
Post the description of the execution environment. The value for the
environment value could be one of BaremetalServer, LXC Container,
Docker container, VirtualServer depending on the value for the "type"
of the execution environment.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Getst the initial configuration for the LCP.
get.description:
Gets the initial configuration for the LCP. This includes information about itself
like the execution environment ID (lcp.id), the URL where the LCP can be
contacted and a human readable name.

200.description: Gets the LCP basic information.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post initial configuration for the LCP.
post.description:
Post initial configuration for the LCP. This includes information about itself
like the execution environment ID (lcp.id), the URL where the LCP can be
contacted and a human readable name.

This request will trigger a "self discovery" of the deployment of the
execution environment (baremental, container, vm), network configuration,
disks, cpus, ram, etc

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Gets the description of the known elements that a host with a LCP is interacting with.
get.description:
Gets a description of the components known that the host is working with according to a classical client/server
paradigm. This includes relationship with other components like publish-subscribe, connection to databases,
external storage drives (NFS, iSCSI, Dropbox), etc.

200.description: Get the Server's configuration infromation from LCP

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

post.summary: Post the description of the elements a host with an LCP is interacting with.
post.description:
Post a description of the components that the host is working with according to a classical client/server
paradigm. This includes relationship with other components like publish-subscribe, connection to databases,
external storage drives (NFS, iSCSI, Dropbox), etc.

201.description: The external components which our node is interacting with has been successfully updated.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

delete.summary: Deletes the description of a known element that a host with a LCP is interacting with.
delete.description:
Deletes a description of the components known that the host was working with according to a classical client/server
paradigm.

204.description: The resource has been correctly deleted

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.summary: Gets the description of the known elements that a host with a LCP is interacting with.
get.description:
Gets a description of the components known that the host is working with according to a classical client/server
paradigm. This includes relationship with other components like publish-subscribe, connection to databases,
external storage drives (NFS, iSCSI, Dropbox), etc.

200.description: Get the Server's configuration infromation from LCP, but only the required ID.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

put.summary: Updates the description of a known element that a host with a LCP is interacting with.
put.description:
UPdates a description of the components known that the host was working with according to a classical client/server
paradigm.

204.description: The resource has been correctly updated

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

get.description: Gets all data the LCP has about itself and its environment. Gets all data the LCP has, specially to the Context Broker, so the CB can integrate this data in its knownledge base. The Context Broker will be the one to call this method since there is no pushing information to the CB from the LCP. This is so mainly for security reasons.

200.description: retrieves all info the LCP has about itself.

404.description: Unconfigured LCP. No data to be retrieved this way.

500.description: Server not available to satisfy the request.

product.description: Name of this piece of Software instance

type.description: Class SoftwareDefinition. The value must be SoftwareDefinition

address.description: Server address or IP where the software is listening

vendor.description: Name of the Vendor for this software

version.description: Version of the Piece of Software installed

type.description: Class SoftwareDefinition. The value must be ContainerDescription

software.description: Description of the Software contained in the container

id.description: Unique ID for the Son LCP

type.description: FIWARE's type for this class: LCPDescription

url.description: URL where the Son LCP Listens

description.description: A Human readable description, so it is easy to identify

name.description: Name for the LCP in readable human format

url.description: URL where the Son LCP Listens

type.description: Type of server acting as CloudController
Type of server acting as CloudController

controller_id.description: ID of the Compute host. The controller could act as compute

partner.description: Name of the partner/owner of the Agent

hasAgentType.description: Id of the Agent Type Associated with this Agent Instance

endpoint_url.description: URL if some to configure the Parameters.

vendor.description: Name of the vendor providing the security Function

version.description: Version of the Security Property associated

status.description: Update the status the of the agent-instance if the command is executed correctly.
Update the status the of the agent-instance according to cmd condition

type.description: Type of the Parameter: Int, Number, String...

list.description: Marks whether a parameter is list or not

description.example: This is the config file for an agent

path.description: Path of the Agent config file

example.example: points to an example config file

source.description: The config file where parameters are configured

schema.description: Type of configuration file (json, yaml, etc.)

partner.description: Name of the Partner who created the resource

actions.description: List of actions and expected result fro this agent

jsonSchema.description: Pointer for the json describing the data from this kind of agents

resources.description: List of agents Resources that could be used

type.description: Class ExecutionEnvironment. The value must be ExecutionEnvironment

environment.description: Definition of environment hardware. Can be one of the types LXCContainer, DockerContainer, VirtualServer, BaremetalServer

id.description: ID of this external Storage type

type.description: Type of the document. It must be External Storage

description.description: High level description for this remote storage drive

softwareArtifacts.description: Software artifacts interacting with this LCP

port.description: Port where the LCP is listening

https.description: Defines the protocol to connect the LCP. HTTPS if true, HTTP if false

description.description: Human readable description for the Network link

type_id.description: network link type for this link

id.description: Unique ID for the Son LCP

hostname.description: Hostname of the Host where the LCP can be contacted. If a proxy is behind the LCP, the value should be the proxy host

enabled.description: Describes if the LCP is enabled or not

description.description: A Human readable description, so it is easy to identify

hw_info.description: Definition of environment hardware. Can be one of the types LXCContainer, DockerContainer, VirtualServer, BaremetalServer

network_links.description: Network links connection to other hosts

exec_env.description: LCP Description as required by the CB
